column1: '''''nwalme''''' (earlier pronounced '''''ngwalme''''' or '''''ŋwalme'''''<ref group="note">[[Helge Fauskanger]] has suggested that the forms ''nwalmë''/''ngwalmë'' (retaining the same meaning) could be valid [[Neo-Elvish
column2: Neo-Quenya]]; see [http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/wordlists.htm Quettaparma Quenyallo (Quenya Wordlists] (accessed 29 November 2010).</ref>) is a [[Quenya]] noun meaning "torment".<ref name="Names">{{App
column3: Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

column2: left]]''Nwalme'' is also the name in Quenya of the twentieth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the fourth letter of the fifth grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "nasal" consonants and it is the fifth letter in the fourth series of consonants.  For written Quenya or [[Sindarin]], the fourth series is used for labialized or ''kw''-series, the ''[[Quessetéma]]'', and ''Nwalme'' represents '''NGW''' or '''ŊW'''.  In [[Westron]] the fourth series is used for the ''k''-series, the ''[[Calmatéma]]'', and this letter represents '''NG''' or '''Ŋ'''.<ref>{{App
column3: Letters}}</ref>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Ngá'''''.<ref>See [[Westron Tengwar]]</ref>

column1: The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme
* [http://www.uib.no/People/hnohf/qlist.htm Quenya Corpus Wordlist] edited by [[Helge Fauskanger]]
